alert.note: Alert for City of Portsmouth (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 16 at 5:47PM EDT until June 16 at 8:30PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 615 PM EDT FOR ...THE SOUTHWESTERN CITY OF NORFOLK...THE NORTHWESTERN CITY OF CHESAPEAKE...THE SOUTHERN CITY OF PORTSMOUTH AND THE CENTRAL CITY OF SUFFOLK... At 546 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Suffolk, or over Downtown Suffolk, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to vehicles is possible. Expect wind damage to trees and powerlines. This severe storm will be near... Downtown Suffolk around 550 PM EDT. Driver around 600 PM EDT. Chesapeake, Bowers Hill and Western Branch around 605 PM EDT. Deep Creek around 610 PM EDT. Downtown Portsmouth, Downtown Norfolk and Cradock around 615 PM EDT. Great Bridge around 620 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this severe thunderstorm include South Norfolk, Portlock, Lummis, Suffolk Airport, Herberts Corner, Saunders, Magnolia, Wilroy, Nurney and Kilby. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
